The services below can help keep you and your family safe and informed in case of a natural disaster: 
 **Public Safety Command Center (112)**  
Emergency response for any type of crisis or disaster.  
üìû *Emergency number: 112*  
üì± *Mobile App: **112Georgia***  
- Free and available on Android and iOS  
- Shares your exact location with emergency services  
- Available in Georgian, English, Russian, Armenian, and Azerbaijani  
‚ö†Ô∏è *False or hoax calls are illegal and punishable by law.*


**National Environment Agency**  
Provides official information on weather conditions, natural hazards, and environmental updates.  
üìç 150 Davit Aghmashenebeli Ave, 0112, Tbilisi
üìû +995 32 243 95 03 / +995 32 243 95 10

If you need emotional support, help finding services, or assistance with daily life, the organizations below are here for you: 

**Georgian Centre for the Psychosocial and Medical Rehabilitation of Torture Victims (GCRT)**  
Offers psychosocial and medical help to all Ukrainian refugees in Georgia.  
Services include:  
- Social worker and psychologist consultations  
- Medical referrals and examinations  
- Legal service referrals  
- Medical and psychological forensic evaluations  
- Hotline support  

üìç 9 Veriko Anjaparidze St, Tbilisi, 0179  
üìû +995 032 2 22 06 89 / +995 577 12 68 68 / +995 577 22 68 68  
üñ•Ô∏è Remote consultations available from anywhere in Georgia



**World Vision Multi-Service Centre**  
Community centers supporting refugees and stateless people with:  
- Information on rights and services in Georgia  
- Social worker support and group activities  
- Job search assistance and skills development  
- Psychosocial support  

üìç Tbilisi: 67b Zhiuli Shartava St  
üìç Batumi: 40 Giorgi Mazniashvili St  
üìû Hotline: +995 577 04 56 45  
üñ•Ô∏è Remote consultations available from anywhere in Georgia

If you or your family need medical help, medication, or social assistance, the services below are available to you:
 **Ministry of Internally Displaced Persons from the Occupied Territories, Health, Labour and Social Affairs of Georgia**  
Main government body for health, labour, and social support.  
üìç 144 Akaki Tsereteli Ave, Tbilisi* 
üìû Hotline: 1505 / +995 32 2 51 00 26


**Internally Displaced Persons, Ecomigrants and Livelihood Agency**  
Runs the **State Program for Supporting the Integration of Foreigners Living in Georgia**, offering:  
- Medical services  
- Medication support (up to 1,500 GEL)  
For people with international protection (asylum seekers, refugees, humanitarian status holders, and stateless persons).  

üìç *15a Mikheil Tamarashvili St, 0186, Tbilisi*  
üìû *Hotline: +995 32 2 51 00 26*


 **In Case of Emergency**  
Public Safety Command Center*
üìû Emergency number: 112

**The Division of International Protection of the Migration Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Georgia**
Main State authority responsible for asylum procedures and registering asylum-seekers
Address: 16, Mikheil Gakhokidze street, 0182, Tbilisi, Georgia 
Phone: +995 598 08 00 97 

**Public Defender of Georgia (Ombudsman)**
A constitutional institution, which supervises the potection of human rights and freedoms within its jurisdiction on the territory of Georgia.
Address: 150, Davit Agmashenebeli Avenue, 0112, Tbilisi, Georgia
Hotline: 1481 (functional 24/7)

**Legal Aid Service of Georgia (LAS)** 
The entity under public law, which provides legal consultations, prepares legal documents and provides court representation for free.
Address: Tbilisi Legal Aid Bureau: 14, Tamar Mepe Avenue, 0112, Tbilisi, Georgia.
Contact information: (+995 32) 292 00 55

**The office of the United Nations Hight Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)** 
The main national organization working on refugees and asylum procedures in Georgia.
Address: 2a, Aleksandre Kazbegi Avenue, 0160, Tbilisi, Georgia.
Hotline: (+995) 577 415 610

**International Organization for Migration (IOM)** 
The international organization, which supports state agencies in development of national migration related management systems. IOM provides assistance in voluntary return, also for persons in detention.
Address: 12, Tengiz Abuladze 1st Lane (Dead End), 0162, Tbilisi, Georgia
Hotline: (+995 32) 2 91 43 61

**NGO Rights Georgia**
This is the partner of UNHCR providing free legal assistance to asylum-seekers and refugees  and stateless individuals in Georgia. 
Legal counseling on various legal issues, including international protection and border crossing; residence permits; state assistance for Ukrainians living in Georgia; labor disputes; rent agreements; gender-based violence, etc. 
Address: 11a Akaki Gakhokidze Street, 0160, Tbilisi, Georgia
Hotline: (+995) 593 111 405; (+995) 555 10 73 00

If you‚Äôve come to Georgia with your family, there is help available. From financial assistance and housing to language and educational programs, these services are here to support you as you rebuild your life:

 **State Financial Assistance for Ukrainian Refugees**  
Under Government Decree #1254 (extended until July 2025), financial support is available for Ukrainian refugees in Georgia.  
Support includes:  
- **300 GEL per family + 45 GEL per person**  
- 10 days of emergency accommodation for new arrivals after 15 July (and continued support if assessed as vulnerable)  
- Families already receiving aid will continue to receive it until **1 July 2025** without reassessment  

üìû *Hotline for emergency accommodation: 1505 (Ministry of Health)*  
üóÇÔ∏è *Register for financial aid at the nearest Social Services Agency office*


**Happy Space Tbilisi**  
üìç 111 Dimitri Uznadze St, Tbilisi
üìû +995 577 25 90 16  

**Happy Space Batumi**  
üìç 72 Takaishvili St, Batumi  
üìû +995 577 65 73 02


 **Free Georgian Language and Civic Education Courses**  
Offered by the Internally Displaced Persons, Ecomigrants and Livelihood Agency  
- Free for asylum seekers, refugees, humanitarian status holders, and stateless persons  
- Civic education classes to help with integration  
- Ages 16+, register anytime  
- Online and in-person classes available  
üìç Face-to-face: 15a Mikheil Tamarashvili St, 0186, Tbilisi  
üìû +995 555 000 119 / +995 511 142 384 / (032) 2 14 02 42  
üìß info@idp.gov.ge

**Funding for Sports, Arts, and Educational Courses (Under Age 18)**  
If you're under 18 and have refugee, humanitarian, or stateless status:  
- You can apply for funding up to **1,500 GEL per year** for courses  
- Applies to sports, creative, and educational activities  
- Monthly payments made directly to the institution  
üìç Apply at the agency‚Äôs office or by post (forms available at [www.idp.moh.gov.ge](http://www.idp.moh.gov.ge)) 
üìß info@idp.gov.ge*  
üìû *+995 511 14 23 84*  
;
**Agency Addresses:**  
- Tbilisi: 15a M. Tamarashvili St.  
- Gori: 1 Sameba St.  
- Rustavi: 20 Kostava St.  
- Kutaisi: 27 Ir. Abashidze Ave.  
- Zugdidi: 106 D. Aghmashenebeli St.

 **Temporary Reception Centre for Asylum Seekers**  
Shelter for vulnerable asylum seekers provided by the Ministry of Internal Affairs.  
- Located in **Village Martkopi**, near Tbilisi  
- Separate blocks for families, women, and single men  
- Facilities include a play area, football field, internet room, and Georgian language classes  
üìç Apply via the Division of International Protection  
üìç 16 Mikheil Gakhokidze St, 0182, Tbilisi
üìû +995 598 08 00 97  
üìß dipi@mia.gov.ge
